dublin_core.dcvalue: Anderson, R. K. (2018). Beyond Copy Room Collaboration: A Case Study of Online Informal Teacher Professional Learning. In Kay, J. and Luckin, R. (Eds.) Rethinking Learning in the Digital Age: Making the Learning Sciences Count, 13th International Conference of the Learning Sciences (ICLS) 2018, Volume 3. London, UK: International Society of the Learning Sciences.

With the ubiquity of social media and the access to information instantly, teachers, like the rest of society, are turning to the internet for support. This study investigates how a public Facebook group mediates contextually relevant professional learning. Using a qualitative case study research design, a Facebook group tailored to mathematics education is analyzed based on 1) how group members share knowledge, and 2) the use of discourse structures to support professional learning.
